intro: Brachystelma pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, fleshy, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with short stems and is often found in coastal regions. Brachystelma pygmaeum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
